member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpRbwFilterType.FftBased
member.summary: No RBW filtering is performed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpRbwFilterType.Gaussian
member.summary: An RBW filter with a Gaussian response is applied.

member.summary: An RBW filter with a flat response is applied.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpRbwFilterType.SynchTuned4
member.summary: An RBW filter with a 4-pole synchronously-tuned response is applied.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpRbwFilterType.SynchTuned5
member.summary: An RBW filter with a 5-pole synchronously-tuned response is applied.

member.summary: The measurement does not use any RBW filtering.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXCcdfRbwFilterType.Gaussian
member.summary: The RBW filter has a Gaussian response.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXCcdfRbwFilterType.Flat

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpRbwFilterBandwidthDefinition
member.summary: Specifies the bandwidth definition which you use to specify the value of the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpRbwFilterBandwidthDefinition.BandwidthDefinition3dB
member.summary: Defines the RBW in terms of the 3 dB bandwidth of the RBW filter. When you set the method to , RBW is the 3 dB bandwidth of the window specified by the method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpConfiguration
member.summary: Provides methods to configure the channel power (CHP) measurement.
member.remarks: For more information about NI-RFmx SpecAn, refer to the NI-RFmx SpecAn Help.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpConfiguration.ConfigureAveraging(System.String,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingEnabled,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingType)
member.summary: Configures averaging for the channel power (CHP) measurement.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies whether to enable averaging for the measurement.
Specifies the number of acquisitions used for averaging when you set the to .

Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for the measurement. Refer to the Averaging section of the Spectrum topic for more information about averaging types.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_CHPCfgAveraging() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpConfiguration.ConfigureFft(System.String,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpFftWindow,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures window and FFT to obtain a spectrum for the channel power (CHP) measurement.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage. Refer to the Window and FFT section of the Spectrum topic for more information about FFT window types.

Specifies the factor by which the time-domain waveform is zero-padded before FFT. The FFT size is given by the following formula: waveform size * padding. This parameter is used only when the acquisition span is less than the device instantaneous bandwidth of the device.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_CHPCfgFFT() function in C.

member.summary: Configures the frequency range, in hertz (Hz), over which the measurement integrates the carrier channel power.
member.param: Specifies the carrier number. Example: "carrier0". You can use the method to build the selector string.
Specifies the frequency range, in Hz, over which the measurement integrates the carrier channel power.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_CHPCfgIntegrationBandwidth() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpConfiguration.ConfigureRbwFilter(System.String,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpRbwAutoBandwidth,System.Double,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpRbwFilterType)
member.summary: Configures the resolution bandwidth (RBW) filter.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies whether the measurement computes the RBW. Refer to the RBW and Sweep Time section in the CHP topic for more details on RBW and sweep time.
Specifies the bandwidth, in hertz (Hz), of the RBW filter used to sweep the acquired signal, when you set the method to .
Specifies the shape of the digital RBW filter.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_CHPCfgRBWFilter() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpConfiguration.ConfigureRrcFilter(System.String,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpCarrierRrcFilterEnabled,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures the root-raised-cosine (RRC) filter to apply on the channel before measuring the channel power.
member.param: Specifies the carrier number. Example: "carrier0". You can use the method to build the selector string.
Specifies whether to apply the RRC filter on the acquired channel before measuring the channel power.
Specifies the roll-off factor for the RRC filter.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_CHPCfgRRCFilter() function in C.

member.summary: Configures the device to wait for the complex power of the I/Q data to cross the specified threshold and then marks a reference point within the record.

Specifies the channel from which the device monitors the trigger.

Specifies the power level, in dBm, at which the device triggers. The device asserts the trigger when the signal exceeds the level specified by the value of this parameter, taking into consideration the specified slope.

Specifies the trigger delay time, in seconds.
Specifies whether the measurement computes the minimum quiet time used for triggering.

to enable the trigger; otherwise .

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMX.AutoLevel(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Examines the incoming signal to calculate the peak power level and sets it as the value of the method. Use this method to help calculate an approximate setting for the power level for measurements. When using NI 5663, 5665, or 5668R devices, NI recommends that you set an appropriate value for mechanical attenuation before calling the method. Setting an appropriate value for mechanical attenuation reduces the number of times the attenuator settings are changed by this method, thus reducing wear and tear, and maximizing the life time of the attenuator.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies the bandwidth, in hertz (Hz), of the signal to be analyzed.
Specifies the acquisition length, in seconds. Use this value to compute the number of samples to acquire from the signal analyzer.
Upon return, contains the estimated peak power level, in dBm, of the input signal.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks:
The method performs the following tasks:
Resets the mixer level, mixer level offset and IF output power offset.
Sets the starting reference level to the maximum reference level supported by the device based on the current RF attenuation, mechanical attenuation and preamp enabled settings.
Iterates to adjust the reference level based on the input signal peak power.
This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_AutoLevel() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMX.AnalyzeIQ(System.String,System.String,NationalInstruments.ComplexWaveform{NationalInstruments.ComplexSingle},System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary:
Performs the enabled measurements on the I/Q complex waveform that you specify in the iq parameter. Call this method after you configure the signal and measurement properties. You can fetch measurement results using the Fetch methods. Use this method only if the RFmxInstrMX.GetRecommendedAcquisitionType method value is either IQ or IQ or Spectral. This method is supported only when the RFmxInstr session is created with option string "AnalysisOnly=1".
Query the RFmxInstrMX.GetRecommendedAcquisitionType method after calling the method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising the result name. The result name can either by specified through this input or the resultName input. If you do not specify the result name in this input, either the result name specified by the resultName input or the default result instance is used.
Example:
""
"result::r1"

Specifies the name to be associated with measurement results. Provide a unique name, such as "r1" to enable fetching of multiple measurement results and traces. This input accepts the result name with or without the "result:" prefix.
Example:
""
"result::r1"
"r1"
Specifies the data for a complex IQ waveform including the start, delta, and actual values.
Resets the measurement averaging. If you enable averaging, set this parameter to TRUE for first record and FALSE for subsequent records.
Indicates whether averaging on all the enabled measurments is complete.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_AnalyzeIQ() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMX.Dispose
member.summary: Deletes the signal configuration if it is not the default signal configuration and clears any trace of the current signal configuration, if any.
member.remarks: You can call this method safely more than once, even if the signal is already deleted.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMX.GetLimitedConfigurationChange(System.String,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXLimitedConfigurationChange@)
member.summary: Gets the set of properties that are considered by NI-RFmx in the locked signal configuration state.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Upon return, contains the set of properties that are considered by NI-RFmx in the locked signal configuration state.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
member.remarks: If your test system performs the same measurement at multiple frequencies and/or power levels repeatedly, enabling this method can help achieve faster measurements. When you set this method to a value other than , the NI-RFmx driver will use an optimized code path and skip some checks. Because RFmx skips some checks when you use this method, you need to be aware of the limitations of this feature, which are listed in the Limitations of the Limited Configuration Change Property topic. You can also use this property to lock a specific instrument configuration for a signal so that every time that you initiate the signal, NI-RFmx applies the RFmxInstr properties from a locked configuration. NI recommends you use this method in conjunction with named signal configurations. Create named signal configurations for each measurement configuration in your test program and set this method to a value other than , for one or more of the named signal configurations. This allows RFmx to precompute the acquisition settings for your measurement configurations and re-use the precomputed settings each time you initiate the measurement. You do not need to use this method if you create named signals for all the measurement configurations in your test program during test sequence initialization and do not change any RFInstr or personality properties while testing each device under test. RFmx automatically optimizes that use case. Specify the named signal configuration you are setting this method in the selector string input. This method gets the value of attribute.The default value is .

member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.

member.remarks: If your test system performs the same measurement at multiple frequencies and/or power levels repeatedly, enabling this method can help achieve faster measurements. When you set this method to a value other than , the NI-RFmx driver will use an optimized code path and skip some checks. Because RFmx skips some checks when you use this method, you need to be aware of the limitations of this feature, which are listed in the Limitations of the Limited Configuration Change Property topic. You can also use this property to lock a specific instrument configuration for a signal so that every time that you initiate the signal, NI-RFmx applies the RFmxInstr properties from a locked configuration. NI recommends you use this method in conjunction with named signal configurations. Create named signal configurations for each measurement configuration in your test program and set this method to a value other than , for one or more of the named signal configurations. This allows RFmx to precompute the acquisition settings for your measurement configurations and re-use the precomputed settings each time you initiate the measurement. You do not need to use this method if you create named signals for all the measurement configurations in your test program during test sequence initialization and do not change any RFInstr or personality properties while testing each device under test. RFmx automatically optimizes that use case. Specify the named signal configuration you are setting this method in the selector string input.This method sets the value of attribute.The default value is .

member.summary: Specifies whether the absolute limit threshold is a flat line or a line with a slope.

member.summary: The line specified by the values that you specify in the and methods as the two ends is considered as the threshold.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurAbsoluteLimitMode.Couple
member.summary: The two ends of the line are coupled to the value of the method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable the offset segment for spectral emission mask (SEM) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetEnabled.False
member.summary: Disables the offset segment for the SEM measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetEnabled.True
member.summary: Enables the offset segment for the SEM measurement.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for the Harmonics measurement. The averaged power trace is used for the measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmAveragingType.Rms
member.summary: The power trace is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power trace is averaged in a logarithm scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power trace is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum instantaneous power in the power trace is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum instantaneous power in the power trace is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpRrcFilterEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to apply the root-raised-cosine (RRC) filter on the acquired channel after measuring the channel power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpRrcFilterEnabled.False
member.summary: The channel power of the acquired channel is measured directly.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpRrcFilterEnabled.True
member.summary: The measurement applies the RRC filter on the acquired channel before measuring the channel power.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetPowerReferenceCarrier
member.summary: Specifies the carrier to be used as power reference to measure the offset channel relative power. The offset channel power is measured only if you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetPowerReferenceCarrier.Closest
member.summary: The measurement uses the power measured in the carrier closest to the offset channel center frequency, as the power reference.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetPowerReferenceCarrier.Highest
member.summary: The measurement uses the highest power measured among all the active carriers as the power reference.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetPowerReferenceCarrier.Composite
member.summary: The measurement uses the sum of powers measured in all the active carriers as the power reference.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetPowerReferenceCarrier.Specific
member.summary: The measurement uses the power measured in the carrier that has an index specified by the method, as the power reference.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdUserDpdModel.LookupTable
member.summary: This model computes the complex gain coefficients applied while performing digital predistortion to linearize systems with negligible memory effects.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdUserDpdModel.MemoryPolynomial
member.summary: This model computes the memory polynomial predistortion coefficients used to linearize systems with moderate memory effects.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdUserDpdModel.GeneralizedMemoryPolynomial
member.summary: This model computes the generalized memory polynomial predistortion coefficients used to linearize systems with significant memory effects.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFftWindow
member.summary: Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFftWindow.None
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is shorter than the window length. You can also use this window type to separate two tones with frequencies close to each other but with almost equal amplitudes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFftWindow.FlatTop
member.summary: Measures single-tone amplitudes accurately.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFftWindow.Hanning
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is longer than the window length. You can also use this window type to provide better frequency resolution for noise measurements.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFftWindow.Hamming
member.summary: Analyzes closely-spaced sine waves.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFftWindow.Gaussian
member.summary: Provides a good balance of spectral leakage, frequency resolution, and amplitude attenuation. This windowing is useful for time-frequency analysis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFftWindow.Blackman
member.summary: Analyzes single tone because it has a low maximum side lobe level and a high side lobe roll-off rate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFftWindow.BlackmanHarris
member.summary: Useful as a good general purpose window, having side lobe rejection greater than 90 dB and having a moderately wide main lobe.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFftWindow.KaiserBessel
member.summary: Separates two tones with frequencies close to each other but with widely-differing amplitudes.

member.summary: Specifies that all samples are considered for the measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpThresholdEnabled.True
member.summary: Specifies that the samples above the threshold level specified in the method are considered for the measurement.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumConfiguration.ConfigureAveraging(System.String,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingEnabled,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingType)
member.summary: Configures averaging for the Spectrum measurement.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies whether to enable averaging for the measurement.
Specifies the number of acquisitions used for averaging when you set the method to .

Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for the measurement. Refer to the Averaging section of the Spectrum topic for more information about averaging types.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_SpectrumCfgAveraging() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumConfiguration.ConfigureFft(System.String,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumFftWindow,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures window and FFT to obtain a spectrum for the Spectrum measurement.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage. Refer to the Window and FFT section of the Spectrum topic for more information about FFT window types.

Specifies the factor by which the time-domain waveform is zero-padded before FFT. The FFT size is given by the following formula: waveform size * padding. This parameter is used only when the acquisition span is less than the device instantaneous bandwidth of the device.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_SpectrumCfgFFT() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmResults.FetchHarmonicMeasurement(System.String,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Fetches the power measured at the harmonic frequency.
member.param: Specifies the result name and harmonic number. Example: "harmonic0", "result::r1/harmonic0". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the average power, in dB, relative to the fundamental power measured at the harmonic.
Upon return, contains the average absolute power, in dBm, measured at the harmonic.
Upon return, contains the resolution bandwidth (RBW), in hertz (Hz), which is used by the harmonic measurement, for the harmonic.
Upon return, contains the RF frequency, in Hz, of the harmonic.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_HarmFetchHarmonicMeasurement() function in C.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the THD, measured as a percentage of the power in the fundamental signal. THD calculation involves only the harmonics that are enabled.
Upon return, contains the average power, in dBm, measured at the fundamental frequency.
Upon return, contains the frequency, in hertz (Hz), used as the fundamental frequency.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the spectrum measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingEnabled.False
member.summary: The measurement is performed on a single acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingEnabled.True
member.summary: The spectrum measurement uses the value of the as the number of acquisitions over which the spectrum measurement is averaged.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetAbsoluteLimitMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the absolute limit mask is a flat line or a line with a slope.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetAbsoluteLimitMode.Manual
member.summary: The line specified by the and method values as the two ends is considered as the mask.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetAbsoluteLimitMode.Couple
member.summary: The two ends of the line are coupled to the value of the method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwRbwFilterType
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the digital resolution bandwidth (RBW) filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwRbwFilterType.FftBased
member.summary: No RBW filtering is performed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwRbwFilterType.Gaussian
member.summary: The RBW filter has a Gaussian response.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwRbwFilterType.Flat
member.summary: The RBW filter has a flat response.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwRbwFilterType.SynchTuned4
member.summary: The RBW filter has a response of a 4-pole synchronously-tuned filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwRbwFilterType.SynchTuned5
member.summary: The RBW filter has a response of a 5-pole synchronously-tuned filter.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXCcdfThresholdType
member.summary: Specifies the reference for the power level used for thresholding.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXCcdfThresholdType.Relative
member.summary: The threshold is relative to the peak power, in dB, of the acquired samples.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXCcdfThresholdType.Absolute
member.summary: The threshold is the absolute power, in dBm.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCarrierRbwFilterBandwidthDefinition

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpRbwFilterType.Gaussian
member.summary: The RBW filter has a Gaussian response.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpRbwFilterType.Flat

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpRbwFilterType.SynchTuned4

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpRbwFilterType.SynchTuned5

member.summary: An RBW filter with a 5-pole synchronously-tuned response is applied.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpMeasurementMethod
member.summary: Specifies the method for performing the adjacent channel power (ACP) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpMeasurementMethod.Normal
member.summary: The ACP measurement acquires the spectrum using the same signal analyzer setting across frequency bands. Use this value when measurement speed is desirable over higher dynamic range.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpMeasurementMethod.DynamicRange
member.summary: The ACP measurement acquires the spectrum using the hardware-specific optimizations for different frequency bands.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpMeasurementMethod.SequentialFft
member.summary:
The ACP measurement acquires all the samples specified by the ACP Sweep Time method and divides them in to smaller chunks of equal size defined by the method. FFT is computed for each chunk. The resultant FFTs are averaged to get the spectrum used to compute the ACP. If the total acquired samples is not an integer multiple of the FFT size, the remaining samples at the end of the acquisition are not used. Use this method to optimize for speed. The accuracy of results may be reduced when using this measurement method.
The following methods have limited support when you set the RFmxTdscdmaMXAcpConfiguration.ConfigureMeasurementMethod method to SequentialFft.
The RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.SetRbwFilterAutoBandwidth method will only support True value.
The RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.SetRbwFilterType method will only support FftBased value.
The RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.SetFftWindow method will only support None and Flat Top value.
The RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.SetSweepTimeAuto method will only support False value.
The RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.SetAveragingCount method will only support a value of 1.
The RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.SetNoiseCompensationEnabled method will only support False value.
The RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.SetNumberOfAnalysisThreads method will only support a value of 1.
The RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.SetAmplitudeCorrectionType Method will only support a value of RFCenterFrequency.
The RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.SetOffsetRelativeAttenuation Method will only support 0.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpCarrierMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to consider the carrier power as part of the total carrier power measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpCarrierMode.Passive
member.summary: The carrier power is not considered as part of the total carrier power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpCarrierMode.Active
member.summary: The carrier power is considered as part of the total carrier power.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFDutInputLossCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the noise figure (NF) measurement accounts for ohmic losses between the noise source and the input port of the DUT, excluding the losses that are common to calibration and the measurement steps for the Y-Factor method, which are specified by the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFDutInputLossCompensationEnabled.False
member.summary: The NF measurement ignores the ohmic losses.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFDutInputLossCompensationEnabled.True
member.summary: The NF measurement accounts for the ohmic losses.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFCalibrationLossCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the noise figure (NF) measurement accounts for the ohmic losses between the noise source and input port of the analyzer during the calibration step, excluding any losses which you have specified using the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFCalibrationLossCompensationEnabled.False
member.summary: The NF measurement ignores the ohmic losses.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFCalibrationLossCompensationEnabled.True
member.summary: The NF measurement accounts for the ohmic losses.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMRbwFilterType.FftBased
member.summary: No RBW filtering is performed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMRbwFilterType.Gaussian

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMRbwFilterType.Flat
member.summary: An RBW filter with a flat response is applied.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMRbwFilterType.SynchTuned4

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMRbwFilterType.SynchTuned5
member.summary: An RBW filter with a 5-pole synchronously-tuned response is applied.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmThresholdType.Absolute

member.summary: Configures averaging for the transmit power (TXP) measurement.

Specifies whether to enable averaging for the measurement.

member.summary: Configures averaging for the adjacent channel power (ACP) measurement.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies whether to enable averaging of the spectrum for ACP measurement.
Specifies the number of acquisitions used for averaging when you set the method to .
Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple Spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for ACP measurement.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_ACPCfgAveraging() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.ConfigureCarrierAndOffsets(System.String,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures a carrier channel with offset channels on both sides of the carrier as specified by the number of offsets. The offset channels are separated by +/- (n*channel) spacing from the center of the carrier. Power is measured over the integration bandwidth for each channel.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies the frequency range, in hertz (Hz), over which the measurement integrates the carrier channel power.
Specifies the number of offset channels.
Specifies the spacing between offset channels.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_ACPCfgCarrierAndOffsets() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.ConfigureFft(System.String,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpFftWindow,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures window and FFT to obtain a spectrum for the adjacent channel power (ACP) measurement.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage.

Specifies the factor by which the time-domain waveform is zero-padded before FFT. The FFT size is given by the following formula: waveform size * padding. This parameter is used only when the acquisition span is less than the device instantaneous bandwidth of the device.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_ACPCfgFFT() function in C.

member.summary: Configures the power reference to use for measuring the relative power of the offset channel.
member.param: Specifies the offset number. Example: "offset0". You can use the method to build the selector string.
Specifies the carrier to be used as the power reference to measure the offset channel relative power. The offset channel power is measured only if you set to .

Specifies the index of the carrier to be used as the reference carrier. The power measured in this carrier is used as the power reference for measuring the offset channel relative power, when you set the to .
member.returns: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_ACPCfgOffsetPowerReference() function in C. Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpConfiguration.ConfigureOffset(System.String,System.Double,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetSideband,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetEnabled)
member.summary: Configures an offset channel on one or both sides of carrier with center-to-center spacing as specified by the offset frequency and offset frequency definition. In case of multiple carriers, offset frequency is relative to the closest carrier.
member.param: Specifies the offset number. Example: "offset0". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the center or edge frequency, in hertz (Hz), of the offset channel, relative to the center frequency of the closest carrier as determined by the method. The sign of the offset frequency is ignored and the offsetSideband parameter determines whether the upper, lower, or both offsets are measured.
Specifies whether the offset segment is present on one side, or on both sides of the carriers.
Specifies whether to enable the offset channel for ACP measurement.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_ACPCfgOffset() function in C.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRbwAutoBandwidth
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the resolution bandwidth (RBW).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRbwAutoBandwidth.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the RBW that you specify in the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRbwAutoBandwidth.True
member.summary: The measurement computes the RBW.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for spectral emission mask (SEM) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAveragingType.Rms
member.summary: The power spectrum is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power spectrum is averaged in a logarithm scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power spectrum is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The peak power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The least power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAveragingType.Vector
member.summary: The complex FFT vector is averaged across multiple acquisitions. Vector averaging reduces noise from synchronous signals and usually requires a trigger to improve block-to-block phase coherence.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmResults.FetchDutCharacteristics(System.String,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Fetches the mean linear gain, 1 dB compression point, and mean RMS EVM of the device under test.
member.param: Specifies the result name. Example: "", "result::r1". You can use the method to build the selectorString.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the average linear gain, in dB, of the device under test, computed by rejecting signal samples suffering gain compression.

Upon return, contains the theoretical output power, in dBm, at which gain of the device under test drops by 1 dB from its mean linear gain. This parameter returns NaN when the AM-to-AM characteristics of the device under test are flat.
Upon return, contains the ratio, as a percentage, of l2 norm of difference between the normalized reference and acquired waveforms, to the l2 norm of the normalized reference waveform.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_AMPMFetchDUTCharacteristics() function in C.

Upon return, contains the peak-to-peak deviation, in dB, in the gain of the device under test.
Upon return, contains the peak-to-peak deviation, in degrees, in the phase distortion of the acquired signal relative to the reference waveform caused by the device under test.

member.summary:
Configures the intermod order, intermod side, lower intermod frequency, and upper intermod frequency when you set the method to .
Use "intermod(n)" as the selector string to configure this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of intermod number. Example:
"intermod0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.
Specifies the order of the intermod.
Specifies the frequency of the lower intermodulation product. This value is expressed in Hz.
Specifies the frequency of the upper intermodulation product. This value is expressed in Hz.
Specifies whether to measure intermodulation products corresponding to both lower and upper intermod frequencies or either one of them.
Specifies whether to enable an intermod for the IM measurement.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMConfiguration.ConfigureFft(System.String,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFftWindow,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures the window and FFT to obtain a spectrum for the IM measurement.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage. Refer to the Window and FFT section of the Spectral Measurements> topic for more information about FFT window types.

Specifies the factor by which the time-domain waveform is zero-padded before an FFT. The FFT size is given by the following formula: FFT size = waveform size * padding. This parameter is used only when the acquisition span is less than the device instantaneous bandwidth.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.summary: Fetches the measured carrier power.
member.param: Specifies the result name and carrier number. Example: "", "result::r1/carrier0". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the measured carrier power. The carrier power is reported in dBm or dBm/Hz based on the value of .
Upon return, contains the carrier power, in dB, measured relative to the total carrier power of all active carriers.
Upon return, contains the center frequency, in hertz (Hz), of the carrier relative to the center frequency.
Upon return, contains the frequency range, in Hz, over which the measurement integrates the carrier power.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_ACPFetchCarrierMeasurement() function in C.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIQBandwidthAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the minimum acquisition bandwidth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIQBandwidthAuto.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the value of the method as the minimum acquisition bandwidth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIQBandwidthAuto.True
member.summary: The measurement calculates the minimum acquisition bandwidth as shown in the following equation: minimum acquisition bandwidth = 0.8 * sample rate

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdHeadroomMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to compute and apply the headroom of the predistorted waveform or to apply the value specified by on the predistorted waveform.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdHeadroomMode.Off
member.summary: The measurement returns the predistorted waveform without applying headroom.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdHeadroomMode.Auto
member.summary: The measurement returns the predistorted waveform after computing and applying the headroom.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdHeadroomMode.Manual
member.summary: The measurement returns the predistorted waveform after applying the headroom that you specify in the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFDutOutputLossCompensationEnabled.False
member.summary: The NF measurement ignores ohmic losses.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFDutOutputLossCompensationEnabled.True
member.summary: The NF measurement accounts for the ohmic losses.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMIntermodEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable an intermod for the IM measurement. This method is not used when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMIntermodEnabled.False
member.summary: Disables an intermod for the IM measurement. The results for the disabled intermods are displayed as NaN.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMIntermodEnabled.True
member.summary: Enables an intermod for the IM measurement.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdTargetGainType
member.summary: Specifies the gain expected from the DUT after applying DPD on the input waveform.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdTargetGainType.AverageGain
member.summary: The DPD polynomial or lookup table is computed by assuming that the linearized gain expected from the DUT after applying DPD on the input waveform is equal to the average power gain provided by the DUT without DPD.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdTargetGainType.LinearRegionGain
F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdTargetGainType.PeakInputPowerGain
member.summary: The DPD polynomial or lookup table is computed by assuming that the linearized gain expected from the DUT after applying DPD on the input waveform is equal to the average power gain provided by the DUT, without DPD, to all the samples of the reference waveform for which the magnitude is greater than the peak power in the reference waveform (dBm) - 0.5 dB.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdLookupTableType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the DPD lookup table (LUT).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdLookupTableType.Log
member.summary: Input powers in the LUT are specified in dBm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdLookupTableType.Linear
member.summary: Input powers in the LUT are specified in watts.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemFftWindow
member.summary: Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemFftWindow.None
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is shorter than the window length. You can also use this window type to separate two tones with frequencies close to each other but with almost equal amplitudes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemFftWindow.FlatTop
member.summary: Measures single-tone amplitudes accurately.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemFftWindow.Hanning
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is longer than the window length. You can also use this window type to provide better frequency resolution for noise measurements.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemFftWindow.Hamming
member.summary: Analyzes closely-spaced sine waves.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemFftWindow.Gaussian
member.summary: Provides a good balance of spectral leakage, frequency resolution, and amplitude attenuation. Hence, this windowing is useful for time-frequency analysis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemFftWindow.Blackman
member.summary: Analyzes single tone because it has a low maximum side lobe level and a high side lobe roll-off rate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemFftWindow.BlackmanHarris
member.summary: Useful as a good general purpose window, having side lobe rejection greater than 90 dB and having a moderately wide main lobe.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemFftWindow.KaiserBessel
member.summary: Separates two tones with frequencies close to each other but with widely-differing amplitudes.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetSideband
member.summary: Specifies whether the offset channel is present on one side, or on both sides of the carriers.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetSideband.Negative
member.summary: Configures a lower offset segment to the left of the leftmost carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetSideband.Positive
member.summary: Configures an upper offset segment to the right of the rightmost carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetSideband.Both
member.summary: Configures both negative and positive offset segments.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId
member.summary: Specifies all the attribute identifiers.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.CenterFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the expected carrier frequency, in hertz (Hz), of the RF signal that needs to be acquires. The signal analyzer tunes to this frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.ExternalAttenuation
member.summary: Specifies the attenuation, in dB, of a switch (or cable) connected to the RF IN connector of the RF signal analyzer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.ReferenceLevel
member.summary: Specifies the reference level, in dBm, which represents the maximum expected power of the RF input signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.TriggerType
member.summary: Specifies the type of reference trigger to use for signal acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.DigitalEdgeTriggerSource
member.summary: Returns the source terminal for the digital-edge trigger.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.DigitalEdgeTriggerEdge
member.summary: Specifies whether the RF vector signal analyzer detects a or on the signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IQPowerEdgeTriggerSource
member.summary: Specifies the channel from which the device monitors the trigger.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IQPowerEdgeTriggerLevel
member.summary: Specifies the power level at which the device triggers. This value is expressed in dB when you set the method to and in dBm when you set the method to . The device asserts the trigger when the signal exceeds the level specified by the value of this method, taking into consideration the specified slope.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IQPowerEdgeTriggerSlope
member.summary: Specifies whether the device asserts the trigger when the signal power is rising or falling.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.TriggerDelay
member.summary: Specifies the trigger delay time, in seconds.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.TriggerMinimumQuietTimeMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the minimum quiet time used for triggering.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.TriggerMinimumQuietTimeDuration
member.summary: Specifies a time duration, in seconds, for which the signal must be quiet before the RF signal analyzer arms the I/Q Power Edge trigger.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.ResultFetchTimeout
member.summary: Specifies the time, in seconds, to wait before results are available. Set this value to a time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the RFmx driver waits until the measurement is complete.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AutoLevelInitialReferenceLevel
member.summary: Specifies the initial reference level, in dBm, which the auto level function uses to estimate the peak power of the input signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SpurMeasurementEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable spurious emission (Spur) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SpurNumberOfAnalysisThreads
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of threads used for parallelism for spurious emission (Spur) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SpurNumberOfRanges
member.summary: Specifies the number of range configurations.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SpurRangeEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to measure the spurious emissions in the frequency range.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SpurRangeRelativeAttenuation
member.summary: Specifies the attenuation, in dB, relative to the value of the method. Use the attenuation to compensate for the variations in external attenuation when offset segments are spread wide in frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SpurRangeNumberOfSpursToReport
member.summary: Specifies the number of spurious emissions (Spur) that the measurement should report in the frequency range.

member.summary: Specifies the stop frequency of the frequency range, in hertz (Hz), for the measurement.

member.summary: Specifies the number of acquisitions used for averaging.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SpurAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the spurious emission (Spur) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SpurAveragingType

member.summary: Specifies the sweep time, in seconds, when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpNoiseCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable compensation of the channel powers for the inherent noise floor of the RF signal analyzer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpAllTracesEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable the traces to be stored and retrieved after performing the adjacent channel power (ACP) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsTotalCarrierPower
member.summary: Returns the total integrated power of all the active carriers measured.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsFrequencyResolution
member.summary: Returns the frequency resolution, in hertz (Hz), of the spectrum acquired by the measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsCarrierFrequency
member.summary: Returns the center frequency, in hertz (Hz).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsCarrierIntegrationBandwidth
member.summary: Returns the frequency range, in hertz (Hz), over which the measurement integrates the carrier power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsCarrierAbsolutePower
member.summary: Returns the measured carrier power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsCarrierTotalRelativePower
member.summary: Returns the carrier power, in dB, measured relative to the total carrier power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsLowerOffsetFrequencyReferenceCarrier
member.summary: Returns the carrier index of the center frequency that was used as a reference to define the center frequency of the lower (negative) offset channel. Lower offset channels are channels that are to the left of the reference carrier when the offset frequency specified is a positive value. The reference carrier is the carrier that has an offset frequency closest to the lower offset channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsLowerOffsetFrequency
member.summary: Returns the center frequency of the lower offset channel relative to the center frequency of the closest carrier. The sign of offset frequency is negative.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsLowerOffsetIntegrationBandwidth
member.summary: Returns the integration bandwidth used to measure the power in the lower offset channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsLowerOffsetPowerReferenceCarrier
member.summary: Returns the carrier index of the measured power that was used as a reference to define the lower (negative) offset channel relative power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsLowerOffsetAbsolutePower
member.summary: Returns the lower offset channel power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsLowerOffsetRelativePower
member.summary: Returns the lower offset channel power, in dB, measured relative to the integrated power of the reference carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsUpperOffsetFrequencyReferenceCarrier
member.summary: Returns the carrier index of the center frequency that was used as a reference to define the center frequency of the upper (positive) offset channel. Upper offset channels are channels that are to the right of the reference carrier. The reference carrier is the carrier that has an offset closest to the lower offset channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsUpperOffsetFrequency
member.summary: Returns the center frequency of the upper offset channel relative to the center frequency of the closest carrier. The sign of offset frequency is negative.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsUpperOffsetIntegrationBandwidth
member.summary: Returns the integration bandwidth used to measure the power in the upper offset channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsUpperOffsetPowerReferenceCarrier
member.summary: Returns the carrier index of the measured power that was used as a reference to define the upper (positive) offset channel relative power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsUpperOffsetAbsolutePower
member.summary: Returns the upper offset channel power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpResultsUpperOffsetRelativePower
member.summary: Returns the upper offset channel power, in dB, measured relative to the integrated power of the reference carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpIFOutputPowerOffsetAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes an IF output power level offset for the offset channels to improve the dynamic range of the adjacent channel power (ACP) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpNearIFOutputPowerOffset
member.summary: Specifies the offset, in dB, by which to adjust the IF output power level for offset channels that are near to the carrier channel to improve the dynamic range.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AcpFarIFOutputPowerOffset
member.summary: Specifies the offset, in dB, by which to adjust the IF output power level for offset channels that are far from the carrier channel to improve the dynamic range.

member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the occupied bandwidth (OBW) measurement.

member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for occupied bandwidth (OBW) measurement.

member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the sweep time.

member.summary: Specifies the sweep time, in seconds.

member.summary: Specifies whether to enable the traces to be stored and retrieved after performing the occupied bandwidth (OBW).

member.summary: Specifies whether the power reference is the integrated power or the peak power in the closest carrier channel. The least carrier offset is the carrier closest to all the lower (negative) offset segments. The highest carrier offset is the carrier closest to all the upper (positive) offsets segments.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsLowerOffsetMarginFrequency
member.summary: Returns the frequency, in hertz (Hz), at which the margin occurred in the lower (negative) offset segment.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsLowerOffsetMeasurementStatus
member.summary: Returns the lower offset measurement status based on measurement limits and the fail criteria.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetStartFrequency
member.summary: Returns the start frequency, in hertz (Hz), of the offset segment relative to the closest configured carrier offset.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetStopFrequency
member.summary: Returns the stop frequency, in hertz (Hz), of the offset segment relative to the closest configured carrier offset.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetPowerReferenceCarrier
member.summary: Returns the carrier index for measured power that was used as reference to define the upper (positive) offset segment relative power. The reference carrier is the carrier that has an offset closest to the offset segment.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetTotalAbsolutePower
member.summary: Returns the upper (positive) offset segment power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetTotalRelativePower
member.summary: Returns the power in the upper (positive) offset segment relative to the integrated or peak power of the reference carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetPeakAbsolutePower
member.summary: Returns the peak power measured in the upper (positive) offset segment.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetPeakRelativePower
member.summary: Returns the peak power in the upper (positive) offset segment relative to the integrated or peak power of the reference carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetPeakFrequency
member.summary: Returns the frequency, in hertz (Hz), at which the peak power occurred in the offset segment.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetMargin
member.summary: Returns the margin, in dB, from the limit mask.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetMarginAbsolutePower
member.summary: Returns the power, in dB, at which the margin occurred in the upper (positive) offset segment.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetMarginRelativePower
member.summary: Returns the power, in dB, at which the margin occurred in the upper (positive) offset segment relative to the integrated or peak power of the reference carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetMarginFrequency
member.summary: Returns the frequency, in hertz (Hz), at which the margin occurred in the upper (positive) offset.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SemResultsUpperOffsetMeasurementStatus
member.summary: Returns the upper offset measurement status based on measurement limits and the fail criteria.

member.summary: Specifies the frequency range, in hertz (Hz), around the center frequency, to acquire for the measurement.

member.summary: Specifies the number of acquisitions used for averaging.

member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the channel power (CHP) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.ChpAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions.

member.summary: Specifies the FFT window type used to reduce spectral leakage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.ChpFftPadding
member.summary: Specifies the factor by which the time-domain waveform is zero-padded before FFT. The FFT size is given by the following formula: waveform size * padding.

member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the resolution bandwidth (RBW).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.ChpRbwFilterType
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the digital resolution bandwidth (RBW) filter.

member.summary: Specifies the roll-off factor for the root-raised-cosine (RRC) filter.

member.summary: Specifies whether to apply the root-raised-cosine (RRC) filter on the acquired channel after measuring the channel power.

member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the Spectrum measurement.

member.summary: Specifies the factor by which the time-domain waveform is zero-padded before FFT. The FFT size is given by the following formula: waveform size * padding. This method is applicable only when the acquisition span is less than the device instantaneous bandwidth of the device.

member.summary: Specifies the shape of the digital resolution bandwidth (RBW) filter.

member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the sweep time.

member.summary: Specifies the sweep time, in seconds.

member.summary: Specifies the maximum lag stagger cross term of the digital predistortion (DPD) polynomial when you set the DPD Apply DPD User DPD Model to Memory Polynomial or Generalized Memory Polynomial and set the DPD Apply DPD Config Input to User.

member.summary: Specifies the peak excursion value, in dB, used to find the spurs in the spectrum. The signal should rise and fall by at least the peak excursion value, above the threshold, to be considered a spur.

member.summary: Specifies the number of records to acquire.

member.summary: Specifies the I/Q acquisition time.

member.summary: Specifies the I/Q pretrigger time.

member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the minimum acquisition bandwidth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IQDeleteRecordOnFetch
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement deletes the fetched record.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.FcntResultsAllanDeviation
