member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.SpectrumNoiseCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable compensation of the channel powers for the inherent noise floor of the signal analyzer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.AmpmFrequencyOffsetCorrectionEnabled
member.summary: Enables frequency offset correction for the measurement.When Frequency Offset Correction Enabled is True, the measurement computes and corrects any frequency offset between the reference and the acquired waveforms.When Frequency Offset Correction Enabled is False, frequency offset correction is not performed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.DpdLookupTableType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the DPD lookup table (LUT).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.DpdFrequencyOffsetCorrectionEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable frequency offset correction for the DPD measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.DpdApplyDpdUserLookupTableType
member.summary: Specifies the DPD Lookup Table (LUT) type when you set the method toUser.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMMeasurementEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable the IM measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMFrequencyDefinition
member.summary: Specifies whether the tones and intermod frequencies are relative to the RF center frequency, or are absolute frequencies.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMFundamentalLowerToneFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the frequency of the tone that has a lower frequency among the two tones in the input signal. This value is expressed in Hz.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMFundamentalUpperToneFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the frequency of the tone that has a higher frequency among the two tones in the input signal. This value is expressed in Hz.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMAutoIntermodsSetupEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the intermod frequencies or uses user-specified frequencies.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMMaximumIntermodOrder
member.summary: Specifies the order up to which the RFmx driver measures odd order intermodulation products when you set the Auto Intermods Setup Enabled method to True. The lower and upper intermodulation products are measured for each order.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMNumberOfIntermods
member.summary: Specifies the number of intermods to measure when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMIntermodEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable an intermod for the IM measurement. This method is not used when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMIntermodOrder
member.summary: Specifies the order of the intermod. This method is not used when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMIntermodSide
member.summary: Specifies whether to measure intermodulation products corresponding to both lower and upper intermod frequencies or either one of them. This method is not used when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMLowerIntermodFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the frequency of the lower intermodulation product. This value is expressed in Hz. This method is not used when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMUpperIntermodFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the frequency of the upper intermodulation product. This value is expressed in Hz. This method is not used when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMMeasurementMethod
member.summary: Specifies the method used to perform the IM measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMLocalPeakSearchEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable a local peak search around the tone or intermod frequencies to account for small frequency offsets.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMRbwFilterAutoBandwidth
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the RBW.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMRbwFilterBandwidth
member.summary: Specifies the bandwidth of the RBW filter used to sweep the acquired signal, when you set the method to . This value is expressed in Hz.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMRbwFilterType
member.summary: Specifies the response of the digital RBW filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMSweepTimeAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the sweep time.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMSweepTimeInterval
member.summary: Specifies the sweep time when you set the method to . This value is expressed in seconds.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the IM measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMAveragingCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of acquisitions used for averaging when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for the IM measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMFftWindow
member.summary: Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMFftPadding
member.summary: Specifies the factor by which the time-domain waveform is zero-padded before an FFT. The FFT size is given by the following formula: FFT size = waveform size * padding This method is used only when the acquisition span is less than the device instantaneous bandwidth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMIFOutputPowerOffsetAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes an IF output power level offset for the intermods to maximize the dynamic range of the signal analyzer. This method is used only if you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMNearIFOutputPowerOffset
member.summary: Specifies the offset by which to adjust the IF output power level for the intermods near the carrier channel to improve the dynamic range of the signal analyzer. This value is expressed in dB. This method is used only if you set the method to and the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMFarIFOutputPowerOffset
member.summary: Specifies the offset by which to adjust the IF output power level for the intermods that are far from the carrier channel to improve the dynamic range of the signal analyzer. This value is expressed in dB. This method is used only if you set the method to and the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMAllTracesEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable the traces to be stored and retrieved after performing the IM measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMNumberOfAnalysisThreads
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of threads used for parallelism for the IM measurement. The number of threads can range from 1 to the number of physical cores. The number of threads you set may not be used in calculations. The actual number of threads used depends on the problem size, system resources, data availability, and other considerations.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMResultsFundamentalLowerTonePower
member.summary: Returns the peak power measured around the lower tone frequency when you set the method to . This value is expressed in dBm. When you set the IM Local Peak Search Enabled method to , the measurement returns the power at the lower tone frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMResultsFundamentalUpperTonePower
member.summary: Returns the peak power measured around the upper tone frequency when you set the method to . This value is expressed in dBm. When you set the IM Local Peak Search Enabled method to , the measurement returns the power at the upper tone frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMResultsIntermodOrder
member.summary: Returns the order of the intermod.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMResultsLowerIntermodPower
member.summary: Returns the peak power measured around the lower intermod frequency when you set the method to . This value is expressed in dBm. When you set the IM Local Peak Search Enabled method to , the measurement returns the power at the lower intermod frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMResultsUpperIntermodPower
member.summary: Returns the peak power measured around the upper intermod frequency when you set the method to . This value is expressed in dBm. When you set the IM Local Peak Search Enabled method to , the measurement returns the power at the upper intermod frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMResultsLowerOutputInterceptPower
member.summary: Returns the lower output intercept power. This value is expressed in dBm. Refer to the IM topic for more information about this result.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMResultsUpperOutputInterceptPower
member.summary: Returns the upper output intercept power. This value is expressed in dBm. Refer to the IM topic for more information about this result.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.IMResultsWorstCaseOutputInterceptPower
member.summary: Returns the worst case output intercept power which is equal to the minimum of the values of the IM Results Upper Output Intercept Power and IM Results Lower Output Intercept Power results. This value is expressed in dBm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFMeasurementEnabled
member.summary: Enables the noise figure (NF) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFFrequencyList
member.summary: Specifies the list of frequencies at which the noise figure (NF) of the DUT is computed. This value is expressed in Hz.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFMeasurementBandwidth
member.summary: Specifies the effective noise-bandwidth in which power measurements are performed for the noise figure (NF) measurement. This value is expressed in Hz.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFMeasurementInterval
member.summary: Specifies the duration for which the signals are acquired at each frequency which you specify in the method. This value is expressed in seconds.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the noise figure (NF) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFAveragingCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of acquisitions used for averaging when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFCalibrationSetupId
member.summary: Specifies a unique string identifier with the hardware setup used to perform calibration for the NF measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFExternalPreampPresent
member.summary: Specifies whether an external preamplifier is present in the signal path.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFExternalPreampFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the array of frequencies corresponding to the value of the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFExternalPreampGain
member.summary: Specifies the gain of the external preamplifier as a function of frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFDutInputLossCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the noise figure (NF) measurement accounts for ohmic losses between the noise source and the input port of the DUT, excluding the losses that are common to calibration and the measurement steps for the Y-Factor method, which are specified by the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFDutInputLossFrequency
member.summary: Specifies an array of frequencies corresponding to the value of the method. This value is expressed in Hz.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFDutInputLoss
member.summary: Specifies an array of the the ohmic losses between the noise source and the input port of the DUT, as a function of the frequency. This value is expressed in dB. This loss is accounted for by the NF measurement when you set the method to . You must exclude any loss which is inherent to the noise source and is common between the calibration and measurement steps, and configure the loss using the method. Specify the frequencies at which the losses were measured using the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFDutInputLossTemperature
member.summary: Specifies the physical temperature of the ohmic loss elements considered in the method. This value is expressed in kelvin.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFDutOutputLossCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the noise figure (NF) measurement accounts for ohmic losses between the output port of the DUT and the input port of the analyzer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFDutOutputLossFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the array of frequencies corresponding to the value of the method. This value is expressed in Hz.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFDutOutputLoss
member.summary: Specifies the array of ohmic losses between the output port of the DUT and the input port of the analyzer, as a function of frequency. This value is expressed in dB. This loss is accounted for by the noise figure (NF) measurement when you set the method to . Specify the array of frequencies at which the losses were measured using the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFDutOutputLossTemperature
member.summary: Specifies the physical temperature of the ohmic loss elements specified by the method. This value is expressed in kelvin.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFCalibrationLossCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the noise figure (NF) measurement accounts for the ohmic losses between the noise source and input port of the analyzer during the calibration step, excluding any losses which you have specified using the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFCalibrationLossFrequency
member.summary: Specifies an array of frequencies corresponding to the ohmic losses between the source and the input port of the analyzer. THis value is expressed in Hz. This method is applicable only when you set the method to and set the method to , or when you set the method to and set the NF Meas Method method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFCalibrationLoss
member.summary: Specifies the array of ohmic losses between the noise source and input port of the analyzer during calibration, as a function of frequency. This value is expressed in dB. This loss is accounted for by the noise figure (NF) measurement when you set the method to . You must exclude any loss specified by the method. This method specifies the frequencies at which the method measures the losses.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFCalibrationLossTemperature
member.summary: Specifies the physical temperature of the ohmic loss elements specified by the method. This value is expressed in kelvin.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFMeasurementMethod
member.summary: Specifies the measurement method used to perform the noise figure (NF) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFYFactorMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement should calibrate the noise characteristics of the analyzer or compute the noise characteristics of the DUT when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFYFactorNoiseSourceEnrFrequency
member.summary: Specifies an array of frequencies corresponding to the effective noise ratio (ENR) values specified by the method. This value is expressed in Hz.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFYFactorNoiseSourceEnr
member.summary: Specifies the array of effective noise ratio (ENR) values of the noise source as a function of the frequency. This value is expressed in dB. The corresponding frequencies are specified by the method. This method is used only when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFYFactorNoiseSourceColdTemperature
member.summary: Specifies the calibrated cold noise temperature of the noise source used in the Y-Factor method. This value is expressed in kelvin.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFYFactorNoiseSourceOffTemperature
member.summary: Specifies the physical temperature of the noise source used in the Y-Factor method when the noise source is turned off. This value is expressed in kelvin.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFYFactorNoiseSourceSettlingTime
member.summary: Specifies the time to wait till the noise source used in the Y-Factor method settles to either hot or cold state when the noise source is turned on or off. This value is expressed in seconds.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFYFactorNoiseSourceLossCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the noise figure (NF) measurement should account for ohmic losses inherent to the noise source used in the Y-Factor method common to the calibration and measurement steps.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFYFactorNoiseSourceLossFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the frequencies corresponding to the ohmic loss inherent to the noise source used in the Y-Factor method specified by the method. This value is expressed in Hz.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFYFactorNoiseSourceLoss
member.summary: Specifies an array of the ohmic losses inherent to the noise source used in the Y-Factor method. This value is expressed in dB. This loss is accounted for by the NF measurement when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFYFactorNoiseSourceLossTemperature
member.summary: Specifies the physical temperature of the ohmic loss elements specified in the method. This value is expressed in kelvin.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFColdSourceMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement should calibrate the noise characteristics of the analyzer or compute the noise characteristics of the DUT for the cold source method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFColdSourceInputTerminationVswr
member.summary: Specifies an array of voltage standing wave ratios (VSWR) as a function of frequency of the microwave termination used as the noise source in cold source method. The corresponding array of frequencies is specified by the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFColdSourceInputTerminationVswrFrequency
member.summary: Specifies an array of frequencies corresponding to the voltage standing wave ratios (VSWR) of the microwave termination used in the cold source method as specified by the method. This value is expressed in Hz.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFColdSourceInputTerminationTemperature
member.summary: Specifies the physical temperature of the microwave termination used as the noise source in the cold source method. This value is expressed in kelvin.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFColdSourceDutSParametersFrequency
member.summary: Specifies an array of frequencies corresponding to the s-parameters of the DUT specified by the , , , and properties. This value is expressed in Hz.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFColdSourceDutS21
member.summary: Specifies an array of the gains of the DUT as a function of freqency, when the output port of the DUT is terminated with an impedance equal to the characteristic impedance. This value is expressed in dB. The corresponding array of frequencies is specified by the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFColdSourceDutS12
member.summary: Specifies an array of the input-isolations of the DUT as a function of frequency, when the input port of the DUT is terminated with an impedance equal to the characteristic impedance. This value is expressed in dB. The corresponding array of frequencies is specified by the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFColdSourceDutS11
member.summary: Specifies an array of the input-reflections of the DUT as a function of frequency, when the output port of the DUT is terminated with an impedance equal to the characteristic impedance. This value is expressed in dB.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFColdSourceDutS22
member.summary: Specifies an array of the output-reflections of the DUT as a function of frequency, when the input port of the DUT is terminated with an impedance equal to the characteristic impedance. This value is expressed in dB. The corresponding array of frequencies is specified by the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPropertyId.NFNumberOfAnalysisThreads
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of threads used for parallelism for the noise figure (NF) measurement.

member.summary: Returns an array of the calibration Y-Factors measured at the frequencies specified by the method. This value is expressed in dB. A valid result is returned only when you set the method to .

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerResults.FetchXY(System.String,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Fetches the X and Y locations of the marker.
member.param: Specifies the result name and marker number. Example: "marker0", "result::r1/marker0". You can use the method to build the selector string.
Upon return, contains the marker X location.
Upon return, contains the marker Y location.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_MarkerFetchXY() function in C.

member.summary: Moves the marker to the next highest, next left, or next right peak above the threshold on the configured trace.
member.param: Specifies the result name and marker number. Example: "marker0", "result::r1/marker0". You can use the method to build the selector string.
Specifies the next peak on the trace.
Upon return, indicates whether the next peak has been found on the trace.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_MarkerNextPeak() function in C.

Upon return, contains the total number of peaks above the threshold, when you set the enable the marker threshold.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_MarkerPeakSearch() function in C.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumResults
member.summary: Provides methods to fetch and read the Spectrum measurement results.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumResults.FetchMeasurement(System.String,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Fetches the peak amplitude and frequency at which the peak occurred in the spectrum.
member.param: Specifies the result name. Example: "", "result::r1". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the peak amplitude, of the averaged spectrum. When you set the spectrum span to 0, this method returns the peak amplitude in the time domain power trace.
Upon return, contains the frequency, in hertz (Hz), at the peak amplitude of the averaged spectrum. This parameter is not valid if you set the method to 0.
Upon return, contains the frequency bin spacing, in Hz, of the spectrum acquired by the measurement. This parameter is not valid if you set the method to 0.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_SpectrumFetchMeasurement() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumResults.FetchPowerTrace(System.String,System.Double,NationalInstruments.AnalogWaveform{System.Single}@)
member.summary: Fetches the power trace for the Spectrum measurement.
member.param: Specifies the result name. Example: "", "result::r1". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the power versus time trace.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_SpectrumFetchPowerTrace() function in C.

member.param: Specifies the result name. Example: "", "result::r1". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the Spectrum trace values.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_SpectrumFetchSpectrum() function in C.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the spurious emission (Spur) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurAveragingEnabled.False
member.summary: The measurement is performed on a single acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurAveragingEnabled.True
member.summary: The Spur measurement uses the method as the number of acquisitions over which the Spur measurement is averaged.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRbwAutoBandwidth
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the resolution bandwidth (RBW).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRbwAutoBandwidth.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the RBW that you specify in the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRbwAutoBandwidth.True
member.summary: The measurement computes the RBW.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerType
member.summary: Configures the marker type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerType.Off
member.summary: The marker is disabled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerType.Normal
member.summary: The marker is enabled as a normal marker.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerType.Delta
member.summary: The marker is enabled as a delta marker.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpSweepTimeAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the sweep time.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpSweepTimeAuto.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the sweep time that you specify in the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpSweepTimeAuto.True
member.summary: The measurement calculates the sweep time based on the value which you configure in the method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable the offset channel for adjacent channel power (ACP) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetEnabled.False
member.summary: Disables the offset channel for ACP measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetEnabled.True
member.summary: Enables the offset channel for ACP measurement.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpFftWindow
member.summary: Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpFftWindow.None
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is shorter than the window length. You can also use this window type to separate two tones with frequencies close to each other but with almost equal amplitudes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpFftWindow.FlatTop
member.summary: Measures single-tone amplitudes accurately.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpFftWindow.Hanning
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is longer than the window length. You can also use this window type to provide better frequency resolution for noise measurements.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpFftWindow.Hamming
member.summary: Analyzes closely-spaced sine waves.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpFftWindow.Gaussian
member.summary: Provides a good balance of spectral leakage, frequency resolution, and amplitude attenuation. Hence, this windowing is useful for time-frequency analysis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpFftWindow.Blackman
member.summary: Analyzes single tone because it has a low maximum side lobe level and a high side lobe roll-off rate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpFftWindow.BlackmanHarris
member.summary: Useful as a good general purpose window, having side lobe rejection >90dB and having a moderately wide main lobe.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpFftWindow.KaiserBessel
member.summary: Separates two tones with frequencies close to each other but with widely-differing amplitudes.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAmplitudeCorrectionType
member.summary: Specifies whether the amplitude of the frequency bins, used in the measurement, is corrected for external attenuation at the RF center frequency, or at the individual frequency bins. Use the _RFmxInstrCfgExternalAttenuationTable function to configure the external attenuation table.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAmplitudeCorrectionType.RFCenterFrequency
member.summary: All the frequency bins in the spectrum are compensated with a single external attenuation value that corresponds to the RF center frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAmplitudeCorrectionType.SpectrumFrequencyBin
member.summary: An individual frequency bin in the spectrum is compensated with the external attenuation value corresponding to that frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumNoiseCompensationEnabled.False
member.summary: Disables compensation of the channel powers for the noise floor of the signal analyzer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumNoiseCompensationEnabled.True
member.summary: Enables compensation of the channel powers for the noise floor of the signal analyzer. The noise floor of the signal analyzer is measured for the RF path used by the Spectrum measurement and cached for future use. If signal analyzer or measurement parameters change, noise floors are measured again.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFConfiguration.GetDutInputLoss(System.String,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Gets an array of the the ohmic losses between the noise source and the input port of the DUT, as a function of the frequency. This value is expressed in dB. This loss is accounted for by the NF measurement when you set the method to . member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFConfiguration.RecommendReferenceLevel(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Computes and sets an appropriate reference level based on the expected maximum DUT gain, maximum DUT noise figure, and other measurement and analyzer methods. You must not set Mixer Level, Mixer Level Offset, IF Output Power Level Offset, and IF Filter Bandwidth methods in order to obtain an appropriate recommended reference level.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
""
""
"result::r1"
You can use the method to build the selector string.
Upon return, contains the expected maximum gain from the DUT. This value is expressed in dB.
Upon return, contains the expected maximum noise figure of the DUT. This value is expressed in dB.
Upon return, contains the recommended reference level for the NF measurement. This value is expressed in dBm.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

Specifies the calibrated cold noise temperature of the noise source used in the Y-Factor method. This value is expressed in kelvin.

Specifies whether the noise figure (NF) measurement should account for ohmic losses inherent to the noise source used in the Y-Factor method common to the calibration and measurement steps.

Specifies the array of the frequencies corresponding to the ohmic loss inherent to the noise source used in the Y-Factor method specified by the noiseSourceLoss parameter. This value is expressed in Hz.

Specifies an array of the ohmic losses inherent to the noise source used in the Y-Factor method. This value is expressed in dB. This loss is accounted for by the NF measurement when you set the noiseSourceLossCompensationEnabled parameter to true. You must specify the frequencies at which the losses were measured using the noiseSourceLossFrequency parameter.
Specifies the physical temperature of the ohmic loss elements specified in the noiseSourceLoss parameter. This value is expressed in kelvin.

Specifies whether the noise figure (NF) measurement accounts for ohmic losses between the noise source and the input port of the DUT, excluding the losses that are common to calibration and the measurement steps, which are specified by the method.
Specifies the array of frequencies corresponding to the value of the DUTInputLoss parameter. This value is expressed in Hz.

Specifies the array of ohmic losses between the noise source and the input port of the DUT, as a method of the frequency. This value is expressed in dB. You must exclude any loss which is inherent to the noise source and is common between the calibration and measurement steps, and configure it using the method. This loss is accounted for by the NF measurement when you set the DUTInputLossCompensationEnabled parameter to . Specify the frequencies at which the losses were measured using the DUTInputLossFrequency parameter.
Specifies the physical temperature of the ohmic loss elements considered in the DUTInputLoss parameter. This value is expressed in kelvin.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.summary: Configures the ohmic loss, as a method of frequency, of the loss elements between the noise source and the input port of the analyzer during the calibration step, excluding the loss specified as the noise source loss.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.

Specifies whether the noise figure (NF) measurement accounts for the ohmic losses between the noise source and input port of the analyzer during the calibration step, excluding any losses which you have specified using the method.

Specifies an array of frequencies corresponding to the ohmic losses between the source and the input port of the analyzer. This value is expressed in Hz. This parameter is applicable only when you set the method to and set the method to , or when you set the method to and set the NF Meas Method method to .

Specifies the array of ohmic losses between the noise source and input port of the analyzer during calibration, as a method of frequency. You must exclude any loss specified by the method. This loss is accounted for by the NF measurement when you set the calibrationLossCompensationEnabled parameter to . This parameter specifies the frequencies at which the calibrationLossFrequency parameter measures the losses.
Specifies the physical temperature of the ohmic loss elements specified by the method. This value is expressed in kelvin.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFConfiguration.ConfigureColdSourceMode(System.String,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFColdSourceMode)
member.summary: Configures the cold source based noise figure (NF) measurement to perform the calibration step or the measurement step.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies whether the measurement should calibrate the noise characteristics of the analyzer or compute the noise characteristics of the DUT for the cold source method.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFConfiguration.ConfigureColdSourceInputTermination(System.String,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Configures the characteristics of the microwave termination used as a noise source in the cold source method.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.

Specifies an array of voltage standing wave ratios (VSWR) as a method of frequency of the microwave termination used as the noise source in cold source method. The corresponding array of frequencies is specified by the terminationVSWRFrequency parameter.
In most cases, the exact VSWR of the microwave termination may not be known. Hence, NI recommends that you set this parameter to an empty array, in which case the noise figure (NF) measurement assumes that the VSWR of the microwave termination is unity for all frequencies.
Specifies an array of frequencies corresponding to the VSWRs of the microwave termination used in the cold source method as specified by the terminationVSWR parameter. This value is expressed in Hz.
Specifies the physical temperature of the microwave termination used as the noise source in the cold source method. This value is expressed in kelvin.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFConfiguration.ConfigureColdSourceDutSParameters(System.String,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Configures the scattering parameters of the DUT as a method of the frequency, for use in the cold source measurement method.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies the array of frequencies corresponding to the s-parameters of the DUT specified by the DUTS21, DUTS12, DUTS11, and DUTS22 parameters. This value is expressed in Hz.

Specifies an array of the gains of the DUT as a method of freqency, when the output port of the DUT is terminated with an impedance equal to the characteristic impedance. This value is expressed in dB. The corresponding array of frequencies is specified by the DUTSParametersFrequency parameter.

Specifies an array of the input-isolations of the DUT as a method of frequency, when the input port of the DUT is terminated with an impedance equal to the characteristic impedance. This value is expressed in dB. The corresponding array of frequencies is specified by the DUTSParametersFrequency parameter.

Specifies an array of the input-reflections of the DUT as a method of frequency, when the output port of the DUT is terminated with an impedance equal to the characteristic impedance. This value is expressed in dB. The corresponding array of frequencies is specified by the DUTSParametersFrequency parameter.

Specifies an array of the output-reflections of the DUT as a method of frequency, when the input port of the DUT is terminated with an impedance equal to the characteristic impedance. This value is expressed in dB. The corresponding array of frequencies is specified by the DUTSParametersFrequency parameter.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMResults.FetchSpectrum(System.String,System.Double,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.Spectrum{System.Single}@)
member.summary: Fetches the spectrum trace in IM measurement corresponding to the specified spectrumIndex.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
""
""
"result::r1"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.

Specifies the index of the spectrum to fetch. When you set the method to or , each of the tone and intermod has a separate spectrum. You can fetch these spectrums one at a time by using a spectrumIndex. The following list shows the spectrumIndex to use while fetching tones and intermods:
Lower tone spectrum: 0
Upper tone spectrum: 1
Lower intermod<n> spectrum: 2n+2
Upper intermod<n> spectrum: 2n+3
Hence, the segment index can range from 0 to 2*(Number of Intermods) + 1. When you set the method to , the IM measurement returns only one spectrum and a spectrumIndex equal to 0 is used to fetch the spectrum.
Upon return, contains the averaged power measured at each frequency bin. This value is expressed in dBm or dBm/Hz.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmAMToAMCurveFitType.LeastAbsoluteResidual

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmAMToAMCurveFitType.Bisquare
member.summary: Excludes the effect of data outliers while minimizing the energy of the polynomial apporoximation error.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIQPowerEdgeTriggerSlope
member.summary: Specifies whether the device asserts the trigger when the signal power is rising or when it is falling. The device asserts the trigger when the signal power exceeds the specified level with the slope you specify. This enum is used only when you set the Trigger Type to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIQPowerEdgeTriggerSlope.Rising
member.summary: The trigger asserts when the signal power is rising.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIQPowerEdgeTriggerSlope.Falling
member.summary: The trigger asserts when the signal power is falling.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingType.Rms
member.summary: The power spectrum is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power spectrum is averaged in a logarithm scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power spectrum is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The peak power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The least power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingType.Vector
member.summary: The complex FFT vector is averaged across multiple acquisitions. Vector averaging reduces noise from synchronous signals and usually requires a trigger to improve block-to-block phase coherence.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpIFOutputPowerOffsetAuto.True

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmAMToPMCurveFitType.LeastSquare
member.summary: Minimizes the energy of the polynomial approximation error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmAMToPMCurveFitType.LeastAbsoluteResidual
member.summary: Minimizes the magnitude of the polynomial approximation error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmAMToPMCurveFitType.Bisquare
member.summary: Excludes the effect of data outliers while minimizing the energy of the polynomial apporoximation error.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurSweepTimeAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the sweep time.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurSweepTimeAuto.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the sweep time that you specify in the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurSweepTimeAuto.True
member.summary: The measurement calculates the sweep time based on the value of the method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to measure the spurious emissions (Spur) in the frequency range.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeEnabled.False
member.summary: Disables the acquisition of the frequency range.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeEnabled.True
member.summary: Enables measurement of Spurs in the frequency range.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for spectrum measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingType.Rms
member.summary: The power spectrum is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power spectrum is averaged in a logarithm scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power spectrum is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The peak power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The least power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumAveragingType.Vector
member.summary: The complex FFT vector is averaged across multiple acquisitions. Vector averaging reduces noise from synchronous signals and usually requires a trigger to improve block-to-block phase coherence.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRelativeLimitMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the relative limit mask is a flat line or a line with a slope.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRelativeLimitMode.Manual
member.summary: The line specified by the values of the and methods as the two ends is considered as the mask.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRelativeLimitMode.Couple
member.summary: The two ends of the line are coupled to the value of the method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRbwFilterType
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the digital resolution bandwidth (RBW) filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRbwFilterType.FftBased
member.summary: No RBW filtering is performed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRbwFilterType.Gaussian
member.summary: The RBW filter has a Gaussian response.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRbwFilterType.Flat
member.summary: The RBW filter has a flat response.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRbwFilterType.SynchTuned4
member.summary: The RBW filter has a response of a 4-pole synchronously-tuned filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetRbwFilterType.SynchTuned5
member.summary: The RBW filter has a response of a 5-pole synchronously-tuned filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCarrierRbwAutoBandwidth.True

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpNoiseCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable compensation of the channel powers for the inherent noise floor of the signal analyzer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpNoiseCompensationEnabled.False
member.summary: Disables compensation of the channel powers for the noise floor of the signal analyzer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpNoiseCompensationEnabled.True
member.summary: Enables compensation of the channel powers for the noise floor of the signal analyzer. The noise floor of the signal analyzer is measured for the RF path used by the ACP measurement and cached for future use. If signal analyzer or measurement parameters change, noise floors are measured again.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdIterativeDpdEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable iterative computation of the DPD Results DPD Polynomial using indirect-learning architecture.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdIterativeDpdEnabled.False
member.summary: The DPD Results DPD Polynomial is computed in a single shot.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdIterativeDpdEnabled.True
member.summary: The DPD Results DPD Polynomial is computed based on the value of the DPD Previous DPD Polynomial.

member.summary: Specifies the predistortion type when you set the method to .

member.summary: The measurement predistorts the magnitude and phase of the input waveform.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdLookupTableCorrectionType.MagnitudeOnly
member.summary: The measurement predistorts only the phase of the input waveform.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdLookupTableCorrectionType.PhaseOnly
member.summary: The measurement predistorts only the magnitude of the input waveform.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetFrequencyDefinition
member.summary: Specifies the offset frequency definition used to specify the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetFrequencyDefinition.CarrierCenterToOffsetCenter
member.summary: The offset frequency is defined from the center of the closest carrier to the center of the offset channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpOffsetFrequencyDefinition.CarrierCenterToOffsetEdge
member.summary: The offset frequency is defined from the center of the closest carrier to the nearest edge of the offset channel.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumRbwFilterBandwidthDefinition
member.summary: Specifies the bandwidth definition which you use to specify the value of the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumRbwFilterBandwidthDefinition.BandwidthDefinition3dB
member.summary: Defines the RBW in terms of the 3dB bandwidth of the RBW filter. When you set the method to FFT Based, RBW is the 3dB bandwidth of the window specified by the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumRbwFilterBandwidthDefinition.BandwidthDefinition6dB
member.summary: Defines the RBW in terms of the 6dB bandwidth of the RBW filter. When you set the Spectrum RBW Filter Type property to FFT Based, RBW is the 6dB bandwidth of the window specified by the Spectrum FFT Window property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumRbwFilterBandwidthDefinition.BandwidthDefinitionBinWidth
member.summary: Defines the RBW in terms of the spectrum bin width computed using FFT when you set the Spectrum RBW Filter Type property to FFT Based.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumRbwFilterBandwidthDefinition.BandwidthDefinitionEnbw
member.summary: Defines the RBW in terms of the ENBW bandwidth of the RBW filter. When you set the Spectrum RBW Filter Type method to FFT Based, RBW is the ENBW bandwidth of the window specified by the Spectrum FFT Window method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFYFactorNoiseSourceLossCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the noise figure (NF) measurement should account for ohmic losses inherent to the noise source used in the Y-Factor method common to the calibration and measurement steps.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFYFactorNoiseSourceLossCompensationEnabled.False
member.summary: Ohmic losses are ignored.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXNFYFactorNoiseSourceLossCompensationEnabled.True
member.summary: Ohmic losses are accounted for in the NF measurement.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFrequencyDefinition
member.summary: Specifies whether the tones and intermod frequencies are relative to the RF center frequency, or are absolute frequencies.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFrequencyDefinition.Relative
member.summary: The tone and intermod frequencies are relative to the RF center frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMFrequencyDefinition.Absolute
member.summary: The tone and intermod frequencies are absolute frequencies. The measurement ignores the RF center frequency.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmThresholdEnabled

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmThresholdEnabled.False

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmThresholdEnabled.True

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpResults
member.summary: Provides methods to fetch and read the transmit power (TXP) measurement results.
member.remarks: For more information about NI-RFmx SpecAn, refer to the NI-RFmx SpecAn Help.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpResults.FetchMeasurement(System.String,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Fetches the powers measured using the transmit power (TXP) measurement.
member.param: Specifies the result name. Example: "", "result::r1". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.

Upon return, contains the mean power, in dBm, of the signal. Only the samples above the threshold are used by the measurement when you set the method to . When you set the method to , the mean power is measured on the power trace averaged over multiple acquisitions.

Upon return, contains the ratio of the peak power of the signal to the mean power. Only the samples above the threshold are used by the measurement when you set the method to . When you set the method to , the peak and mean powers are measured using the power trace averaged over multiple acquisitions.
Upon return, contains the maximum power, in dBm, of the averaged power trace.
Upon return, contains the minimum power, in dBm, of the averaged power trace.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_TXPFetchMeasurement() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpResults.FetchPowerTrace(System.String,System.Double,NationalInstruments.AnalogWaveform{System.Single}@)
member.summary: Fetches the power trace used for the transmit power (TXP) measurement.
member.param: Specifies the result name. Example: "", "result::r1". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the power versus time traces.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_TXPFetchPowerTrace() function in C.

Upon return, contains the mean power, in dBm, of the signal. Only the samples above the threshold are used by the measurement when you set the method to . When you set the method to , the mean power is measured on the power trace averaged over multiple acquisitions.

Upon return, contains the ratio of the peak power of the signal to the mean power. Only the samples above the threshold are used by the measurement when you set the method to . When you set the method to , the peak and mean powers are measured using the power trace averaged over multiple acquisitions.
Upon return, contains the maximum power, in dBm, of the averaged power trace.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for the measurement. Refer to the Averaging section of the Spectrum topic for more information about averaging types.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurAveragingType.Rms
member.summary: The power spectrum is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power spectrum is averaged in a logarithm scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power spectrum is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The peak power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The least power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurAveragingType.Vector
member.summary: The complex FFT vector is averaged across multiple acquisitions. Vector averaging reduces noise from synchronous signals and usually requires a trigger to improve block-to-block phase coherence.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemPowerUnits
member.summary: Specifies the units for the absolute power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemPowerUnits.dBm
member.summary: The absolute powers are reported in dBm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemPowerUnits.dBmPerHertz
member.summary: The absolute powers are reported in dBm/Hz.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetSideband
member.summary: Specifies whether the offset segment is present on one side, or on both sides of the carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetSideband.Negative
member.summary: Configures a lower offset segment to the left of the leftmost carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetSideband.Positive
member.summary: Configures an upper offset segment to the right of the rightmost carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetSideband.Both
member.summary: Configures both negative and positive offset segments.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetLimitFailMask
member.summary: Specifies the criteria to determine the measurement fail status.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetLimitFailMask.AbsoluteAndRelative
member.summary: The measurement fails if the power in the segment exceeds both the absolute and relative masks.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetLimitFailMask.AbsoluteOrRelative
member.summary: The measurement fails if the power in the segment exceeds either the absolute or relative mask.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetLimitFailMask.Absolute
member.summary: The measurement fails if the power in the segment exceeds the absolute mask.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetLimitFailMask.Relative
member.summary: The measurement fails if the power in the segment exceeds the relative mask.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCarrierRbwFilterType
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the digital resolution bandwidth (RBW) filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCarrierRbwFilterType.FftBased
member.summary: No RBW filtering is performed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCarrierRbwFilterType.Gaussian
member.summary: The RBW filter has a Gaussian response.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCarrierRbwFilterType.Flat
member.summary: The RBW filter has a flat response.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCarrierRbwFilterType.SynchTuned4
member.summary: The RBW filter has a response of a 4-pole synchronously-tuned filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCarrierRbwFilterType.SynchTuned5
member.summary: The RBW filter has a response of a 5-pole synchronously-tuned filter.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwFftWindow
member.summary: Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwFftWindow.None
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is shorter than the window length. You can also use this window type to separate two tones with frequencies close to each other but with almost equal amplitudes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwFftWindow.FlatTop
member.summary: Measures single-tone amplitudes accurately.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwFftWindow.Hanning
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is longer than the window length. You can also use this window type to provide better frequency resolution for noise measurements.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwFftWindow.Hamming
member.summary: Analyzes closely-spaced sine waves.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwFftWindow.Gaussian
member.summary: Provides a good balance of spectral leakage, frequency resolution, and amplitude attenuation. Hence, this windowing is useful for time-frequency analysis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwFftWindow.Blackman
member.summary: Analyzes single tone because it has a low maximum side lobe level and a high side lobe roll-off rate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwFftWindow.BlackmanHarris
member.summary: Useful as a good general purpose window, having side lobe rejection greater than 90 dB and having a moderately wide main lobe.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwFftWindow.KaiserBessel
member.summary: Separates two tones with frequencies close to each other but with widely-differing amplitudes.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for occupied bandwidth (OBW) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwAveragingType.Rms
member.summary: The power spectrum is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power spectrum is averaged in a logarithm scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power spectrum is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The peak power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The least power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwAveragingType.Vector
member.summary: The complex FFT vector is averaged across multiple acquisitions. Vector averaging reduces noise from synchronous signals and usually requires a trigger to improve block-to-block phase coherence.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmRbwFilterType
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the digital resolution bandwidth (RBW) filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmRbwFilterType.None
member.summary: The measurement does not use any RBW filtering.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmRbwFilterType.Gaussian
member.summary: The RBW filter has a Gaussian response.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmRbwFilterType.Flat
member.summary: The RBW filter has a flat response.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmRbwFilterType.SynchTuned4
member.summary: The RBW filter has a response of a 4-pole synchronously-tuned filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmRbwFilterType.SynchTuned5
member.summary: The RBW filter has a response of a 5-pole synchronously-tuned filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXHarmRbwFilterType.Rrc
member.summary: The RRC filter with the roll-off specified by the is used as the RBW filter.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDigitalEdgeTriggerEdge
member.summary: Specifies the active edge for the trigger. This enum is used only when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDigitalEdgeTriggerEdge.Rising
member.summary: The trigger asserts on the rising edge of the signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDigitalEdgeTriggerEdge.Falling
member.summary: The trigger asserts on the falling edge of the signal.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpSweepTimeAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the sweep time.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpSweepTimeAuto.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the sweep time that you specify in the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpSweepTimeAuto.True
member.summary: The measurement calculates the sweep time based on the value of the method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpCarrierRrcFilterEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to apply the root-raised-cosine (RRC) filter on the acquired carrier channel before measuring the carrier channel power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpCarrierRrcFilterEnabled.False
member.summary: The channel power of the acquired carrier channel is measured directly.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpCarrierRrcFilterEnabled.True
member.summary: The measurement applies the RRC filter on the acquired carrier channel before measuring the carrier channel power.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the DPD measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdAveragingEnabled.False
member.summary: Performs the measurement on a single acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdAveragingEnabled.True
member.summary: The DPD measurement uses the value returned by as the number of acquisitions over which to average the signal.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwRbwFilterBandwidthDefinition
member.summary: Specifies the bandwidth definition which you use to specify the value of the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwRbwFilterBandwidthDefinition.BandwidthDefinition3dB
member.summary: Defines the RBW in terms of the 3 dB bandwidth of the RBW filter. When you set the method to , RBW is the 3 dB bandwidth of the window specified by the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwRbwFilterBandwidthDefinition.BandwidthDefinitionBinWidth
member.summary: Defines the RBW in terms of the bin width of the spectrum computed using an FFT when you set the method to .

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMSweepTimeAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the sweep time.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMSweepTimeAuto.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the sweep time that you specify in the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMSweepTimeAuto.True
member.summary: The measurement computes the sweep time based on the value of the method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging the power over multiple acquisitions. The averaged power trace is used for the measurement. Refer to the Averaging section of the Spectrum topic for more information about averaging types.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpAveragingType.Rms
member.summary: The power trace is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power trace is averaged in a logarithm scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power trace is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The peak power in the power trace at each sample instance is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTxpAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The least power in the power trace at each sample instance is retained from one acquisition to the next.
