member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurMeasurementStatus
member.summary: Indicates the overall measurement status.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurMeasurementStatus.Fail
member.summary: Indicates that the amplitude of the detected spurs is greater than the value of the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurMeasurementStatus.Pass
member.summary: Indicates that the amplitude of the detected spurs is lower than the value of the method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the spectral emission mask (SEM) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAveragingEnabled.False
member.summary: The measurement is performed on a single acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAveragingEnabled.True
member.summary: The SEM measurement uses the value of the method as the number of acquisitions over which the SEM measurement is averaged.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwPowerUnits
member.summary: Specifies the units for the absolute power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwPowerUnits.dBm
member.summary: The absolute powers are reported in dBm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXObwPowerUnits.dBmPerHertz
member.summary: The absolute powers are reported in dBm/Hz.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerThresholdEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable the threshold for the trace while finding the peaks.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerThresholdEnabled.False
member.summary: Disables the threshold for the trace while finding the peaks.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerThresholdEnabled.True
member.summary: Enables the threshold for the trace while finding the peaks.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXFcntAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for the frequency count (Fcnt) measurement. The averaged instantaneous signal phase difference is used for the measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXFcntAveragingType.Mean
member.summary: The mean of the instantaneous signal phase difference over multiple acquisitions is used for the frequency measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXFcntAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum instantaneous signal phase difference over multiple acquisitions is used for the frequency measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXFcntAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum instantaneous signal phase difference over multiple acquisitions is used for the frequency measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXFcntAveragingType.MinMax
member.summary: The maximum instantaneous signal phase difference over multiple acquisitions is used for the frequency measurement. The sign of the phase difference is ignored to find the maximum instantaneous value.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpFftWindow
member.summary: Specifies the FFT window type used to reduce spectral leakage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpFftWindow.None
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is shorter than the window length. You can also use this window type to separate two tones with frequencies close to each other but with almost equal amplitudes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpFftWindow.FlatTop
member.summary: Measures single-tone amplitudes accurately.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpFftWindow.Hanning
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is longer than the window length. You can also use this window type to provide better frequency resolution for noise measurements.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpFftWindow.Hamming
member.summary: Analyzes closely-spaced sine waves.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpFftWindow.Gaussian
member.summary: Provides a good balance of spectral leakage, frequency resolution, and amplitude attenuation. Hence, this windowing is useful for time-frequency analysis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpFftWindow.Blackman
member.summary: Analyzes single tone because it has a low maximum side lobe level and a high side lobe roll-off rate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpFftWindow.BlackmanHarris
member.summary: Useful as a good general purpose window, having side lobe rejection >90dB and having a moderately wide main lobe.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpFftWindow.KaiserBessel
member.summary: Separates two tones with frequencies close to each other but with widely-differing amplitudes.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for adjacent channel power (ACP) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAveragingType.Rms
member.summary: The power spectrum is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power spectrum is averaged in a logarithm scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power spectrum is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The peak power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The least power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAveragingType.Vector
member.summary: The complex FFT vector is averaged across multiple acquisitions. Vector averaging reduces noise from synchronous signals and usually requires a trigger to improve block-to-block phase coherence.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerNextPeak
member.summary: Moves the marker to the next highest, next left, or next right peak above the threshold on the configured trace.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerNextPeak.NextHighest
member.summary: Moves the marker to the next highest peak above the threshold on the configured trace.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerNextPeak.NextLeft
member.summary: Moves the marker to the next peak to the left of the configured trace.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXMarkerNextPeak.NextRight
member.summary: Moves the marker to the next peak to the right of the configured trace.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdModel
member.summary: Specifies the DPD model used by the DPD measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdModel.LookupTable
member.summary: This model computes the complex gain coefficients applied when performing digital predistortion to linearize systems with negligible memory effects.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdModel.MemoryPolynomial
member.summary: This model computes the memory polynomial predistortion coefficients used to linearize systems with moderate memory effects.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdModel.GeneralizedMemoryPolynomial
member.summary: This model computes the generalized memory polynomial predistortion coefficients used to linearize systems with significant memory effects.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMAveragingType

member.summary: The power spectrum is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power spectrum is averaged in a logarithmic scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power spectrum is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The peak power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The least power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.summary: Specifies the predistortion type when you set the method to or .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdMemoryModelCorrectionType.MagnitudeAndPhase
member.summary: The measurement predistorts the magnitude and phase of the input waveform.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdMemoryModelCorrectionType.MagnitudeOnly
member.summary: The measurement predistorts only the magnitude of the input waveform.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdApplyDpdMemoryModelCorrectionType.PhaseOnly

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetFrequencyDefinition
member.summary: Specifies the definition of the start frequency and stop frequency of the offset segments from the nearest carrier channels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetFrequencyDefinition.CarrierCenterToMeasurementBandwidthCenter
member.summary: The start frequency and stop frequency are defined from the center of the closest carrier channel bandwidth to the center of the offset segment measurement bandwidth. Measurement Bandwidth = Resolution Bandwidth * Bandwidth Integral.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetFrequencyDefinition.CarrierCenterToMeasurementBandwidthEdge
member.summary: The start frequency and stop frequency are defined from the center of the closest carrier channel bandwidth to the nearest edge of the offset segment measurement bandwidth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetFrequencyDefinition.CarrierEdgeToMeasurementBandwidthCenter
member.summary: The start frequency and stop frequency are defined from the nearest edge of the closest carrier channel bandwidth to the center of the nearest offset segment measurement bandwidth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemOffsetFrequencyDefinition.CarrierEdgeToMeasurementBandwidthEdge
member.summary: The start frequency and stop frequency are defined from the nearest edge of the closest carrier channel bandwidth to the edge of the nearest offset segment measurement bandwidth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdLookupTableAMToAMCurveFitType.LeastSquare

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdLookupTableAMToPMCurveFitType
member.summary: Specifies the polynomial approximation cost-function of the device under test AM-to-PM characteristic when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdLookupTableAMToPMCurveFitType.LeastSquare
member.summary: Minimizes the energy of the polynomial approximation error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdLookupTableAMToPMCurveFitType.LeastAbsoluteResidual
member.summary: Minimizes the magnitude of the polynomial approximation error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXDpdLookupTableAMToPMCurveFitType.Bisquare
member.summary: Excludes the effect of data outliers while minimizing the energy of the polynomial approximation error

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXLimitedConfigurationChange
member.summary: Specifies the set of properties that are considered by NI-RFmx in the locked signal configuration state.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXLimitedConfigurationChange.Disabled
member.summary: This is the normal mode of NI-RFmx operation. All configuration changes in RFmxInstr properties or in personality properties will be applied during RFmx Commit.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXLimitedConfigurationChange.NoChange
member.summary: Signal configuration is locked after the first Commit of the named signal configuration. Any configuration change thereafter either in RFmxInstr properties or personality properties will not be considered by subsequent RFmx Commits or Initiates of this signal. Use No Change if you have created named signal configurations for all measurement configurations but are setting some RFmxInstr properties. Refer to the Limitations of the Limited Configuration Change Property topic for more details about the limitations of using this mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXLimitedConfigurationChange.Frequency
member.summary: Signal configuration, other than center frequency and external attenuation, is locked after first Commit of the named signal configuration. Thereafter, only the Center Frequency and method value changes will be considered by subsequent driver Commits or Initiates of this signal. Refer to the Limitations of the Limited Configuration Change Property topic for more details about the limitations of using this mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXLimitedConfigurationChange.ReferenceLevel
member.summary: Signal configuration, other than the reference level, is locked after first Commit of the named signal configuration. Thereafter only the method value change will be considered by subsequent driver Commits or Initiates of this signal. If you have configured this signal to use an IQ Power Edge Trigger, NI recommends that you set the to Relative so that the trigger level is automatically adjusted as you adjust the reference level. Refer to the Limitations of the Limited Configuration Change Property topic for more details about the limitations of using this mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXLimitedConfigurationChange.FrequencyAndReferenceLevel
member.summary: Signal configuration, other than center frequency, reference level, and external attenuation, is locked after first Commit of the named signal configuration. Thereafter only Center Frequency, Reference Level, and External Attenuation method value changes will be considered by subsequent driver Commits or Initiates of this signal. If you have configured this signal to use an IQ Power Edge Trigger, NI recommends you set the IQ Power Edge Level Type to Relative so that the trigger level is automatically adjusted as you adjust the reference level. Refer to the Limitations of the Limited Configuration Change Property topic for more details about the limitations of using this mode.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemResults
member.summary: Provides methods to fetch and read the spectral emission mask (SEM) measurement results.
member.remarks: For more information about NI-RFmx SpecAn, refer to the NI-RFmx SpecAn Help.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemResults.FetchAbsoluteMaskTrace(System.String,System.Double,NationalInstruments.Spectrum{System.Single}@)
member.summary: Fetches the absolute mask trace used for SEM measurement.
member.param: Specifies the result name. Example: "", "result::r1". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the absolute mask trace, in dBm or dBm/Hz, used for the channel.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_SEMFetchAbsoluteMaskTrace() function in C.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemResults.FetchCarrierMeasurement(System.String,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Fetches the carrier power measurement.
member.param: Specifies the result name and carrier number. Example: "carrier0", "result::r1/carrier0". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the carrier power. The power is measured in dBm when you set the method to , and in dBm/Hz when you set the method to .
Upon return, contains the peak power in the carrier channel. The power is measured in dBm when you set the method to , and in dBm/Hz when you set the method to .
Upon return, contains the frequency, in hertz (Hz), at which the peak power occurs in the carrier channel.
Upon return, contains the carrier power, in dB, relative to the total carrier power of all enabled carriers.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_SEMFetchCarrierMeasurement() function in C.

member.summary: Fetches the overall SEM measurement status based on the measurement limits and the fail criteria that you set in the method for each offset segment.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemResults.FetchLowerOffsetMargin(System.String,System.Double,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemLowerOffsetMeasurementStatus@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Fetches the measurement status and margin from the limit line measured in the lower offset segment.
member.param: Specifies the result name and offset number. Example: "offset0", "result::r1/offset0". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Indicates the lower offset measurement status based on measurement limits and the fail criteria that you specify in the method.
Upon return, contains the margin, in dB, from the limit mask value that you set in the method. Margin is defined as the maximum difference between the spectrum and the limit mask.
Upon return, contains the frequency, in hertz (Hz), at which the margin occurred in the lower (negative) offset.

Upon return, contains the power, in dBm or dBm/Hz, at which the margin occurred in the lower (negative) offset segment. The power is measured in dBm when you set the method to , and in dBm/Hz when you set the method to .
Upon return, contains the power, in dB, at which the margin occurred in the lower (negative) offset segment relative to the integrated or peak power of the reference carrier.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_SEMFetchLowerOffsetMargin() function in C.

Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement. Set this value to an appropriate time longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the array of lower offset measurement statuses based on measurement limits and the fail criteria that you specify in the method.
Upon return, contains the array of margins, in dB, from the limit mask value that you set in the method. Margin is defined as the maximum difference between the spectrum and the limit mask.
Upon return, contains the array of frequencies, in hertz (Hz), at which the margin occurred in each lower (negative) offset segment.

member.summary: Configures averaging for the spectral emission mask (SEM) measurement.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies whether to enable averaging for the measurement.
Specifies the number of acquisitions used for averaging when you set the averagingEnabled parameter to .

Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for the measurement. Refer to the Averaging section of the Spectrum topic for more information about averaging types.

Specifies whether to apply the RRC filter on the acquired carrier channel before measuring the carrier channel power.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemConfiguration.ConfigureFft(System.String,NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemFftWindow,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures window and FFT to obtain a spectrum for the spectral emission mask (SEM) measurement.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage. Refer to the Window and FFT section of the Spectrum topic for more information about FFT window types.

Specifies the factor by which the time-domain waveform is zero-padded before FFT. The FFT size is given by the following formula: waveform size * padding. This parameter is used only when the acquisition span is less than the device instantaneous bandwidth of the device.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_SEMCfgFFT() function in C.

member.summary: Configures the absolute limit mode and specifies the absolute power limits corresponding to the beginning and end of the offset segment.

Specifies whether the absolute limit mask is a flat line or a line with a slope.

Specifies the absolute power limit, in dBm, corresponding to the beginning of the offset segment. The value of this parameter is also set as the stop limit for the offset segment when you set the absoluteLimitMode parameter to .
Specifies the absolute power limit, in dBm, corresponding to the end of the offset segment. This parameter is ignored when you set the absoluteLimitMode parameter to Couple.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemConfiguration.ConfigureOffsetBandwidthIntegral(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Configures the resolution of the spectrum to compare with spectral mask limits as an integer multiple of the resolution bandwidth (RBW). If you set this method to a value greater than 1, the measurement acquires the spectrum with a narrow resolution and then processes it digitally to get a wider resolution that is equal to the product of the bandwidth integral and the RBW.
member.param: Specifies the offset number. Example: "offset0". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the resolution of the spectrum to compare with spectral mask limits as an integer multiple of the RBW. If you set this method to a value greater than 1, the measurement acquires the spectrum with a narrow resolution and then processes it digitally to get a wider resolution that is equal to the product of the bandwidth integral and the RBW.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_SEMCfgOffsetBandwidthIntegral() function in C.

Specifies whether to enable the offset segment for the SEM measurement.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurFftWindow
member.summary: Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage. Refer to the Window and FFT section of the Spectrum topic for more information about FFT window types.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurFftWindow.None
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is shorter than the window length. You can also use this window type to separate two tones with frequencies close to each other but with almost equal amplitudes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurFftWindow.FlatTop
member.summary: Measures single-tone amplitudes accurately.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurFftWindow.Hanning
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is longer than the window length. You can also use this window type to provide better frequency resolution for noise measurements.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurFftWindow.Hamming
member.summary: Analyzes closely-spaced sine waves.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurFftWindow.Gaussian
member.summary: Provides a good balance of spectral leakage, frequency resolution, and amplitude attenuation. Hence, this windowing is useful for time-frequency analysis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurFftWindow.Blackman
member.summary: Analyzes single tone because it has a low maximum side lobe level and a high side lobe roll-off rate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurFftWindow.BlackmanHarris
member.summary: Useful as a good general purpose window, having side lobe rejection greater than 90 dB and having a moderately wide main lobe.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurFftWindow.KaiserBessel
member.summary: Separates two tones with frequencies close to each other but with widely-differing amplitudes.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumRbwAutoBandwidth
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the resolution bandwidth (RBW).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumRbwAutoBandwidth.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the RBW that you specify in the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumRbwAutoBandwidth.True
member.summary: The measurement computes the RBW.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumFftWindow
member.summary: Specifies the FFT window type to use to reduce spectral leakage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumFftWindow.None
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is shorter than the window length. You can also use this window type to separate two tones with frequencies close to each other but with almost equal amplitudes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumFftWindow.FlatTop
member.summary: Measures single-tone amplitudes accurately.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumFftWindow.Hanning
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is longer than the window length. You can also use this window type to provide better frequency resolution for noise measurements.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumFftWindow.Hamming
member.summary: Analyzes closely-spaced sine waves.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumFftWindow.Gaussian
member.summary: Provides a good balance of spectral leakage, frequency resolution, and amplitude attenuation. Hence, this windowing is useful for time-frequency analysis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumFftWindow.Blackman
member.summary: Analyzes single tone because it has a low maximum side lobe level and a high side lobe roll-off rate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumFftWindow.BlackmanHarris
member.summary: Useful as a good general purpose window, having side lobe rejection greater than 90 dB and having a moderately wide main lobe.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemLowerOffsetMeasurementStatus
member.summary: Indicates the lower offset segment measurement status based on measurement limits and the fail criteria that you specify in the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemLowerOffsetMeasurementStatus.Fail
member.summary: Indicates that the measurement has failed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemLowerOffsetMeasurementStatus.Pass
member.summary: Indicates that the measurement has passed.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXFcntThresholdEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable thresholding of the acquired samples to be used for the frequency count (Fcnt) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXFcntThresholdEnabled.False
member.summary: All samples are considered for the Fcnt measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXFcntThresholdEnabled.True
member.summary: The samples above the threshold level specified in the method are considered for the Fcnt measurement.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the channel power (CHP) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingEnabled.False
member.summary: The measurement is performed on a single acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpAveragingEnabled.True
member.summary: The ACP measurement uses the value which you specify in the method as the number of acquisitions over which the CHP measurement is averaged.

member.summary: Scales the input waveform to DUT average input power and then predistorts using the DPD polynomial or the lookup table. To scale the waveform correctly, specify if the idle duration is present in the waveform.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies the complex baseband equivalent of the RF signal on which to apply digital predistortion.
Specifies whether the waveform contains an idle duration.
Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for fetching the specified measurement.
Upon return, contains the complex baseband equivalent of the RF signal on which to apply digital predistortion.
Upon return, contains the peak-to-average power ratio of the waveform obtained after applying digital predistortion. This value is expressed in dB.
Upon return, contains the change in the average power in the waveform due to applying digital predistion. This value is expressed in dB.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpCarrierRrcFilterEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to apply the root-raised-cosine (RRC) filter on the acquired channel after measuring the channel power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpCarrierRrcFilterEnabled.False
member.summary: The channel power of the acquired channel is measured directly.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXChpCarrierRrcFilterEnabled.True
member.summary: The measurement applies the RRC filter on the acquired channel before measuring the channel power.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMLocalPeakSearchEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable a local peak search around the tone or intermod frequencies to account for small frequency offsets.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMLocalPeakSearchEnabled.False
member.summary: The measurement returns the power at the tone and intermod frequencies.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMLocalPeakSearchEnabled.True
member.summary: The measurement performs a local peak search around the tone and intermod frequencies to return the peak power.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the IM measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMAveragingEnabled.False
member.summary: The measurement is performed on a single acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMAveragingEnabled.True
member.summary: The IM measurement uses the method as the number of acquisitions over which the IM measurement is averaged.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmMeasurementSampleRateMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the acquisition sample rate is based on the reference waveform.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmMeasurementSampleRateMode.User
member.summary: The acquisition sample rate is defined by the value returned by the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAmpmMeasurementSampleRateMode.ReferenceWaveform
member.summary: The acquisition sample rate is set to match the sample rate of the reference waveform.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTriggerType
member.summary: Specifies the trigger type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTriggerType.None
member.summary: Specifies that no reference trigger is configured.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTriggerType.DigitalEdge
member.summary: Specifies that the reference trigger is not asserted until a digital edge is detected. The source of the digital edge is specified using the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTriggerType.IQPowerEdge
member.summary: The reference trigger is asserted when the signal changes past the level specified by the slope (rising or falling), which is configured using the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXTriggerType.Software
member.summary: The Reference Trigger is not asserted until a software trigger occurs.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemReferenceType
member.summary: Specifies whether the power reference is the integrated power or the peak power in the closest carrier channel. The leftmost carrier is the carrier closest to all the lower (negative) offset segments. The rightmost carrier is the carrier closest to all the upper (positive) offset segments.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemReferenceType.Integration
member.summary: The power reference is the integrated power of the closest carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemReferenceType.Peak
member.summary: The power reference is the peak power of the closest carrier.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCompositeMeasurementStatus
member.summary: Indicates the overall measurement status based on the measurement limits and the fail criteria that you set in the method for each offset segment.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCompositeMeasurementStatus.Fail
member.summary: The measurement has failed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCompositeMeasurementStatus.Pass
member.summary: The measurement has passed.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCarrierRrcFilterEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to apply the root-raised-cosine (RRC) filter on the acquired carrier channel before measuring the carrier channel power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCarrierRrcFilterEnabled.False
member.summary: The channel power of the acquired carrier channel is measured directly.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemCarrierRrcFilterEnabled.True
member.summary: The measurement applies the RRC filter on the acquired carrier channel before measuring the carrier channel power.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the adjacent channel power (ACP) measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAveragingEnabled.False

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXAcpAveragingEnabled.True

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMMeasurementMethod
member.summary: Specifies the method used to perform the IM measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMMeasurementMethod.Normal
member.summary: The IM measurement acquires the spectrum using the same signal analyzer settings across frequency bands. Use this method when the fundamental tone separation is not large. Supported devices: NI 5644R/5645R/5646R, NI 5663/5665, NI 5668R.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMMeasurementMethod.DynamicRange
member.summary: The IM measurement acquires a segmented spectrum using the signal analyzer specific optimizations for different frequency bands. The spectrum is acquired in segments, one per tone or intermod frequency to be measured. The span of each acquired spectral segment is equal to the frequency separation between the two input tones, or 1 MHz, whichever is smaller.Use this method to configure the IM measurement and the signal analyzer for maximum dynamic range instead of measurement speed.Supported devices: NI 5665, NI 5668R.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMMeasurementMethod.Segmented
member.summary: Similar to the Dynamic Range method, this method also acquires a segmented spectrum, except that signal analyzer is not explicitly configured to provide maximum dynamic range. Use this method when the frequency separation of the two input tones is large and the measurement accuracy can be traded off for measurement speed.Supported devices: NI 5644R/5645R/5646R, NI 5663/5665, NI 5668R.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMIFOutputPowerOffsetAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes an IF output power level offset for the intermods to maximize the dynamic range of the signal analyzer. This method is used only if you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMIFOutputPowerOffsetAuto.False
member.summary: The measurement sets the IF output power level offset using the values of the and properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXIMIFOutputPowerOffsetAuto.True
member.summary: The measurement computes an IF output power level offset for the intermods to improve the dynamic range of the IM measurement.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAmplitudeCorrectionType
member.summary: Specifies whether the amplitude of the frequency bins, used in the measurement, is corrected for external attenuation at the RF center frequency, or at the individual frequency bins. Use the _RFmxInstrCfgExternalAttenuationTable function to configure the external attenuation table.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAmplitudeCorrectionType.RFCenterFrequency
member.summary: All the frequency bins in the spectrum are compensated with a single external attenuation value that corresponds to the RF center frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSemAmplitudeCorrectionType.SpectrumFrequencyBin
member.summary: An individual frequency bin in the spectrum is compensated with the external attenuation value corresponding to that frequency.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeDetectorType
member.summary: Specifies the type of detector to be used. Use "range(n)" as the selector string to configure or read this method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeDetectorType.None
member.summary: The detector is disabled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeDetectorType.Sample
member.summary: The middle sample in the bucket is detected.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeDetectorType.Normal
member.summary: The maximum value of the samples within the bucket is detected if the signal only rises or if the signal only falls. If the signal, within a bucket, both rises and falls, then the maximum and minimum values of the samples are detected in alternate buckets.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeDetectorType.Peak
member.summary: The maximum value of the samples in the bucket is detected.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeDetectorType.NegativePeak
member.summary: The minimum value of the samples in the bucket is detected.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeDetectorType.AverageRms
member.summary: The average RMS of all the samples in the bucket is detected.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeDetectorType.AverageVoltage
member.summary: The average voltage of all the samples in the bucket is detected.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpurRangeDetectorType.AverageLog
member.summary: The average log of all the samples in the bucket is detected.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumDetectorType.Normal

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumDetectorType.Peak

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumDetectorType.NegativePeak
member.summary: The minimum value of the samples in the bucket is detected.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXSpectrumDetectorType.AverageRms

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseIntegratedNoiseRangeDefinition
member.summary: Specifies the frequency range for integrated noise measurements.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseIntegratedNoiseRangeDefinition.None
member.summary: Integrated noise measurement is not computed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseIntegratedNoiseRangeDefinition.Measurement
member.summary: The complete log plot frequency range, considered as a single range, is used for computing integrated measurements.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseIntegratedNoiseRangeDefinition.Custom
member.summary: The measurement range(s) specified by PhaseNoise Integrated Noise Start Freq method and the PhaseNoise Integrated Noise Stop Freq method is used for computing integrated measurements.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoise
member.summary: Represents the PhaseNoise measurement.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoise.Configuration
member.summary: Gets the instance that provides methods to configure the PhaseNoise measurement

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoise.Results
member.summary: Gets the instance that provides methods to fetch and read the PhaseNoise measurement results.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseRangeDefinition
member.summary: Specifies how the measurement computes offset subranges.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseRangeDefinition.Auto
member.summary: Measurement computes offset sub-ranges by dividing the user configured offset range into multiple decade sub-ranges. The range is specified by the PhaseNoise Start Freq and the PhaseNoise Stop Freq properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseRangeDefinition.Manual
member.summary: Specify the offset sub-ranges used for the measurement. Use the PhaseNoise Range Start Freq method and the PhaseNoise Range Stop Freq method to configure single or multiple range start and range stop frequencies.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseSpurRemovalEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to remove spurs from the log plot trace.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseSpurRemovalEnabled.False
member.summary: Disables spur removal on the log plot trace.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseSpurRemovalEnabled.True
member.summary: Enables spur removal on the log plot trace.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseFftWindow
member.summary: Specifies the FFT window to use.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseFftWindow.None
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is shorter than the window length. You can also use this window type to separate two tones with frequencies close to each other but with almost equal amplitudes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseFftWindow.FlatTop
member.summary: Measures single-tone amplitudes accurately.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseFftWindow.Hanning
member.summary: Analyzes transients for which duration is longer than the window length. You can also use this window type to provide better frequency resolution for noise measurements.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseFftWindow.Hamming
member.summary: Analyzes closely-spaced sine waves.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseFftWindow.Gaussian
member.summary: Provides a good balance of spectral leakage, frequency resolution, and amplitude attenuation. Hence, this windowing is useful for time-frequency analysis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseFftWindow.Blackman
member.summary: Analyzes single tone because it has a low maximum side lobe level and a high side lobe roll-off rate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseFftWindow.BlackmanHarris
member.summary: Useful as a good general purpose window, having side lobe rejection greater than 90 dB and having a moderately wide main lobe.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.SpecAnMX.RFmxSpecAnMXPhaseNoiseFftWindow.KaiserBessel
member.summary: Separates two tones with frequencies close to each other but with widely-differing amplitudes.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.InstrMX.RFmxSpecAnMXExtension.GetSpecAnSignalConfiguration(NationalInstruments.RFmx.InstrMX.RFmxInstrMX,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a SpecAn signal configuration for specified signal name. Existing SpecAn signal configuration is returned if specified signal name exists.
member.param: Specifies an RFmxInstr session.

Specifies the name of the signal. This parameter accepts the signal name with or without the "signal::" prefix.
Example:
"signal::sig1"
"sig1"
member.returns: Returns an object of type RFmxSpecAnMX.
member.remarks: This method maps to the RFmxSpecAn_CreateSignalConfiguration() function in C.
